starvationevasion.client.model

Class GameData

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.client.model.GameData

  • public class GameData
extends java.lang.Object
    GameOptions stores all of the information we need to find the server we want to connect to, authenticate our login credentials, and pick a region to begin playing.

    • Method Detail

      • getHost

        public java.lang.String getHost()
        Returns the IP/name of the host server we want to connect to.
        Returns:
        the name of the host, in String form.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port through which we want to connect to the host server.
        Returns:
        the port, as an int.

      • getLoginNonce

        public java.lang.String getLoginNonce()
        Returns the client's login nonce for logging in. The nonce is received from the server in a starvationevasion.common.messages.Hello message upon successful connection to the server.
        Returns:
        the client's login nonce, as a String.

      • getNetworkStatus

        public NetworkStatus getNetworkStatus()
        Returns the current network status, for altering client connection behavior based on connectivity.
        Returns:
        the current NetworkStatus.

      • getMainFeed

        public java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<java.lang.String> getMainFeed()
        Returns the client's main feed queue, for use in the starvationevasion.client.Aegislash.GUI.
        Returns:
        the client's main feed.

      • setHost

        public void setHost(java.lang.String host)
        Sets the hostname of the server we want to connect to/are connected to.
        Parameters:
        host - the host IP or name, as a String.

      • setPort

        public void setPort(int port)
        Sets the port through which we'll connect to the server.
        Parameters:
        port - the desired server port, as a String.

      • setLoginNonce

        public void setLoginNonce(java.lang.String loginNonce)
        Set's the client's login nonce. This is done after the client has received a starvationevasion.common.messages.Hello message from the server upon successful connection.
        Parameters:
        loginNonce - the client's login nonce, as a String.

      • setNetworkStatus

        public void setNetworkStatus(NetworkStatus networkStatus)
        Sets the current network status.
        Parameters:
        networkStatus - the current NetworkStatus.

      • addToMainFeed

        public void addToMainFeed(java.lang.String message)
        Adds the passed String to client's message feed/queue. This is utilized for displaying messages in the feed on the starvationevasion.client.Aegislash.GUI.
        Parameters:
        message - a String to add to the feed.

      • getServerState

        public State getServerState()
        Returns the current State, used to modify client behavior based on current game phase/connectivity.
        Returns:
        the current State.

      • getPhaseTime

        public long getPhaseTime()
        Returns the length remaining of the current phase.
        Returns:
        the length of the current phase.

      • getAvailableRegions

        public java.util.Set<EnumRegion> getAvailableRegions()
        Returns the currently available EnumRegions for player selection during the pre-game phase.
        Returns:
        the Set of currently available regions.

      • setServerState

        public void setServerState(State serverState)
        Changes the current server state. Used to handle client-side behavior in response to changes in server state.
        Parameters:
        serverState - the State to change to.

      • setTime

        public void setTime(long serverStartTime,
                    long phaseEndTime)
        Sets the current time, relative to when we connected to the Server
        Parameters:
        serverStartTime - the time the server started.
        phaseEndTime - the time the current phase will end.

      • setAvailableRegions

        public void setAvailableRegions(java.util.Set<EnumRegion> availableRegions)
        Sets the available EnumRegions for player selection during the pre-game phase. This is received from the server in the form of an starvationevasion.common.messages.AvailableRegions message, and then set here by the client.
        Parameters:
        availableRegions - the set of regions not yet assigned to any players.

      • setTakenRegions

        public void setTakenRegions(java.util.Map<EnumRegion,java.lang.String> takenRegions)

      • getTakenRegions

        public java.util.Map<EnumRegion,java.lang.String> getTakenRegions()
